full_summary:
**Solicitation Title:** Compressed Breathing Air Storage/Compressor System for Underwater Recovery Team
**Solicitation Reference:** cb-600-22523535
**Solicitation Number:** M1000-4-4365 (Amendment 10)
**Publication Date:** January 18, 2024
**Tender Closing Date:** February 29, 2024, 1:00 PM AST (Atlantic Time)

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) invites qualified vendors to submit a bid for the delivery of a Compressed Breathing Air Storage and Compressor System (Cascade Filling System) for the Underwater Recovery Team located in B Division (Newfoundland).

The system will be used to support the underwater recovery team's operations and must be delivered on or before March 31, 2024.

The bid selection will be based on the lowest priced responsive bid among all qualified vendors.

The tender documentation package, including detailed specifications and requirements, is available for download on the [Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities).

The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada, and all bidders must comply with the integrity provisions outlined in the tender documentation.

**Important Notice to Bidders:**
+ Vendors are required to submit their bid electronically to ATL_Procurement@rcmp-grc.gc.ca.
+ All bids must be submitted in English or French, along with the bilingual tender document.
+ The RCMP reserves the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.

**Procurement Agency:** RCMP (B Division)
**Contracting Authority:** RCMP RCMP ( Atl-Procurement Unit)
**Point of Contact:** Stephanie Murphy, [Stephanie.Murphy@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:Stephanie.Murphy@rcmp-grc.gc.gc.ca), (902) 720-5832

**Trade Agreements:**
+ This solicitation is open to all qualified suppliers.
+ Canada has adopted the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Indigenous Procurement:**
+ The federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) is available for vendors to expand their visibility and compete for federal government contracts set aside for Indigenous businesses.
